Noun

𒊓𒄴 (sa-aḫ) the god Saḫ SUN, identified with Šamaš:
𒊓𒄠𒋢𒌝 śa-am-śu-um /śamśum/ Shamash sun
𒊓𒄠𒋢𒌝 Shamash 𒀭𒌓 𐤔𐤌𐤔 šmš ܫܡܫܐ šemša שֶׁמֶשׁ šemeš شمس šams 𐣴𐣬𐣴 š'meš

𒌑𒊒𒊓𒅆 úrusalim Jerusalem

𒊓𒋢 sa-su | moth | σής sḗs ցեց cʿecʿ סָס sas עָשׁ ˠash couza ++++

𒇷𒊓𒉡 (li-sa-nu) lišānu lingua/gloss/language/tongue

𒄭 knee/gonu => 𓐍𓈖𓌰𓅓𓋴𓀙𓏜 kinship/companion(ship)/𓋴𓍋𓅓𓂋𓀙𓀀 comrade connection
𒉆𒄭𒊓 (NAM.DU10.SA) companionship, friendship 𒉆 NAM «nomen» 𒄭 DUB3:“top” + 𒊓 SA:“syn/sinew”
𒉆𒄭𒊓 dostī दोस्ती دوستی 𒉆𒆪𒇷 TUᶜLIᵍ дуслык duslıq! friendship (Du²selig;)

𒅀𒁀𒊓 (ya-ba-sa) Jebus, the Caananite settlement of Jerusalem prior to its conquest by King David circa. 1000 BC
𒅀𒁉𒊓 (ya-bi-sa) Jebus -''-

𒊓𒈨𒊑𒄿𒈾𒀀𒀀 (Sa-me-ri-i-na-a-a) Samaria ⋍ שׁמרון region of Palestine
𒊓𒈨𒊑𒈾 Sa-me-ri-na Samaria שומרון (šomron) ancient capital of the northern Kingdom of Israel => Samaritan

𒊓𒊑𒄴;𒊓𒊑𒅔𒋾 si-ri-h < ḵarrab 𒋗𒅆𒌨 "destroy" ? 𒊓𒊑𒄴;𒊓𒊑𒅔𒋾 si-ri-h <> 𒋗𒅆𒌨 ŠU.ḪUL "destroy" ? 𒊓𒊑𒄴;𒊓𒊑𒅔𒋾 si-ri-h <> cedera, from Sanskrit छिद्र (chidra, “hole, opening, defect, flaw”) <> cease ?
